wikipedia_page.main: Polly Devlin OBE (born 1944) is a writer and Irish broadcaster.

link_mentions.page: List of winners and shortlisted authors of the Booker Prize

response: *Polly Devlin, author, journalist, broadcaster and film-maker.

His sister, Marie Devlin, is a school teacher and writer, publishing Over Nine Waves, a collection of traditional Irish myths and legends, in 1994. She was married to the Nobel laureate Seamus Heaney, from 1965 until the poet's death in 2013. One of his six sisters is Polly Devlin, the writer and broadcaster, who has been awarded the OBE for services to literature. Her first book All Of Us There is now a Virago Modern Classic. She has also made a documentary film The Daisy Chain and is a professor at Columbia University, New York.
* Polly Devlin, Author, Broadcaster and Film Writer.

She is the daughter of Andy Garnett and Polly Devlin. Her mother, who received an OBE for service for Literature, worked at both British and American Vogue and wrote the Vogue Book of Fashion Photography."Polly Delvin" Barnard University. Retrieved 5 August 2013.
*Polly Devlin (born 1944), novelist, short story writer, broadcaster
Garnett was born in 1970 to Andy Garnett and Polly Devlin, a writer for Vogue from County Tyrone.
